summary: The Social Security Administration is trying to encourage people with disabilities who get Supplemental Security Income benefits to work if they can. But we testified that working beneficiaries are at a higher risk of benefit overpayments. Beneficiaries who can work may choose not to because they're afraid of being stuck with overpaid benefits that they have to repay. SSA hasn't resolved its lags in processing...
title: Supplemental Security Income: SSA Faces Ongoing Challenges with Work Incentives and Improper Payments
